pageContext.claim: “I'm sure they're [mail-in ballots] not good in Colorado too.”
pageContext.analysis: Colorado's system is considered the gold standard of mail-in balloting. Colorado followed Oregon and Washington state in adopting all-mail ballot elections, holding the first one in 2014. The state continues to see record turnout, according to the secretary of state’s office. In 2018, Colorado had the second highest turnout rate in the country.
